Trial_Design.evidence: Fifty-one patients were randomly assigned to either sildenafil or tadalafil

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to either sildenafil or tadalafil, 1 week before and continued for 3 months after corrective surgery. The control group received a placebo.

Objective.evidence: The aim of our study was to evaluate the effect of the PDE-5 inhibitors

Result_Outcome.evidence: There was no significant difference in the improvement in the right ventricle systolic pressure (RVSP) between both groups, early in the postoperative period ( P = 0.255) and in follow-up ( P = 0.259).
